hero.name: Utkarsh Singh
hero.title: Cloud + Systems Engineer
hero.headline: Cloud + Systems Engineer building reliable platforms, with an MLOps focus.
hero.subtext: Operating production systems, IaC/automation, reliability, observability, and upskilling to build AI products and deploy them on cloud at enterprise level.

highlights.title: 85% Faster Deployments
highlights.description: Release cycles cut from days to hours.

highlights.title: MLOps Pipeline Expert
highlights.description: SageMaker pipelines shortened model ship time.

about.title: About
paragraphs: I'm a Cloud/DevOps Engineer with 2+ years building production infrastructure and MLOps solutions on AWS. Currently pursuing MSc in Cloud Computing at National College of Ireland (graduating April 2026).

My work centers on architecting containerized microservices (Docker/ECS/EKS), automating CI/CD pipelines, and implementing robust observability systems. I've reduced deployment cycles by 85%, cut MTTR by 35%, and achieved 22% AWS cost optimization across multi-account environments.

I'm particularly focused on the intersection of cloud infrastructure and machine learning operations—building SageMaker pipelines, Model Registry workflows, and automated retraining systems that enable rapid, reliable model deployments.

I'm seeking Cloud Architecture, DevOps Engineering, or Technical Leadership roles where I can apply my experience in infrastructure automation, observability, and MLOps to help teams ship faster and more reliably.

education.description: Specializing in distributed systems, DevOpsSec, and scalable cloud programming with AWS, Kubernetes, and Terraform.

projects.name: qpAdm Genomic Modeling on AWS
projects.description: Engineered automated benchmarking pipeline with Terraform-provisioned EC2 Auto Scaling Groups, implementing failure recovery, CloudWatch alerting, and S3 artifact versioning. Applied ML-driven optimization to predict optimal instance families.
projects.outcomes: Executed 15,000+ qpAdm runs. Reduced iterations by 40% and achieved 25-40% cost reduction with 15-30% faster runtimes.

education.thesis: Performance Optimization and Cost Analysis of qpAdm Genomic Modeling
leadership: Head of DJ Society — National College of Ireland
Winner of Student Club and Organization Award 2024-25

education.description: Transfer program completing computational science requirements with focus on software development lifecycle and full-stack development.
modules: Software Testing, Automation, and Quality Assurance

projects.name: Statify - Spotify Analytics Tool
projects.description: Developed a Flask-based web application that analyzes Spotify user listening statistics, displaying top songs, favorite artists, top genres, and personalized recommendations with visual representations.
projects.outcomes: Built full-stack application integrating Spotify API, implemented OAuth authentication, and created dynamic data visualizations for user engagement insights.

education.institution: The University of Texas at Arlington
education.description: Strong foundation in secure system design, software testing, and object-oriented programming principles.

projects.name: CARZZ - Car Rental Platform
projects.description: Developed a full-stack car rental web application with booking system, user authentication, vehicle management, and payment integration using React, Node.js, and MySQL.
projects.outcomes: Implemented complete booking workflow, real-time availability checking, and admin dashboard for fleet management.

projects.name: COVID-19 Tracker App
projects.description: Built a comprehensive COVID-19 tracking application providing real-time statistics, visualizations, and regional data analysis for monitoring pandemic trends.
projects.outcomes: Integrated multiple data APIs, created interactive data visualizations, and deployed production-ready tracking dashboard.

leadership: Teaching Assistant — CSE 3318 Data Structures and Algorithms (50+ students)

responsibilities: Managed multi-client AWS infrastructure across 5+ accounts and 3 regions (us-east-1, us-west-1, ap-south-1), supporting 8 microservices serving 1,000+ users
Containerized 8 legacy Python/Node.js services into multi-stage Docker images with Trivy scanning
Orchestrated Kubernetes clusters and deployed to EKS with blue/green deployments via CodeDeploy
Re-architected CI/CD for 10+ microservices using Jenkins shared libraries and CodePipeline templates
Built production observability with Prometheus metrics, 15+ Grafana dashboards, and CloudWatch Log Insights
Delivered end-to-end MLOps pipelines using SageMaker Pipelines, Model Registry, and EventBridge-triggered retraining
Led 3-4 engineers to standardize deployment workflows across client accounts (promoted after 1.5 years)
achievements: Reduced release cycles from 3 days to 4-6 hours (85% faster)
Cut MTTR from 45 min to 29 min (35% reduction)
Reduced model deployment from 5 days to 2 days across 8-12 campaigns/month

responsibilities: Supported the hockey analytics team with game-day and weekly reporting, delivering stat packs, streaks, and matchup storylines for broadcast and content teams
Optimized PySpark + Azure Data Factory pipelines to ingest play-by-play, player, and historical datasets; validated data quality and reconciled discrepancies
Created dashboards for team performance (shot quality, special teams, goalie trends) and opponent scouting summaries
Collaborated on market-odds trend tracking to surface interesting insights and pregame notes
Automated recurring reports and data pulls with Python to reduce manual preparation time
Partnered with engineering to improve ETL reliability and keep data refreshed for stakeholders
achievements: Cut report preparation time by ~30% through automation
Improved data refresh reliability for game-day reporting
Delivered weekly insight packs used across internal and public-facing content
Increased coverage of opponent scouting notes with standardized templates

platforms: AWS SageMaker (Pipelines, Feature Store, Model Registry, Endpoints, Monitor, Experiments)
